In the name of Allah, Most Gracious, Most Merciful

Assalaamu `alaykum waRahmatullahi Wabarakatoh

The greatest challenge facing the Ummah lies in strengthening their I'tiqadat (beliefs) and Ibadat (acts of devotion). If the beliefs and Ibadat of the Muslim leaders & public are deficient, politics will be totally futile

Nabi صلى الله عليه و سلم is reported to have said;

“The first sign of reformation & progress of this Ummah is that their Yaqeen and belief will become correct and they will lives of contentment. (Bayhaqi #10350)

Based on the above hadith, Hasan Basri رحمه الله تعالى is reported to have said; “the reformation of this Ummah lies in piety”.

Imam Tibi رحمه الله تعالى explains under the above mentioned hadith that; “the correct belief of this Ummah is that they comprehend Allah Ta’ala to be the sole provider and there is no creature except Allah Ta’ala is responsible for its provisions. When this is acknowledged they will lives of contentment”.

Mula Ali Qari رحمه الله تعالى have stated under the aforementioned hadith that; “the sign that the Ummah is on its way to reformation & progress lies in them having correct beliefs in matters of the hereafter”.

Therefore it is essential that as Muslims we correct our yaqeen and belief in Allah Ta’ala and practice our Deen in totality.  Allah Ta’ala says;

“O’ you who belief Enter into Islam perfectly” (02:208)

“Allah Ta’ala does not change the condition of a people unless they change themselves” (13:11)

An effort should be made to strengthen our Iman and actions. How many Muslims really know Islam? How many Muslims perform five daily Salah? How many Muslims dealings are straight? How many Muslims are truthful and honest? What will politics help if Muslims are weak in their faith and actions?

 

And Allah knows best

Wassalam

Ml. Safraz Mohammed,
Student Darul Iftaa
